Package com.intellij.openapi.editor.impl.softwrap

Class ArrowSoftWrapPainter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.editor.impl.softwrap.ArrowSoftWrapPainter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SoftWrapPainter

    public class ArrowSoftWrapPainter
extends java.lang.Object
implements SoftWrapPainter
    SoftWrapPainter implementation that draws arrows in soft wrap location.

    Primary idea is to use dedicated unicode symbols as soft wrap drawings and this class is introduced only as a part of defensive programming - there is unlikely case that local client environment doesn't have a font that is able to represent target unicode symbol. We draw an arrow manually then (platform-independent approach).

      • getDrawingHorizontalOffset

        public int getDrawingHorizontalOffset(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                      SoftWrapDrawingType drawingType,
                                      int x,
                                      int y,
                                      int lineHeight)
        Description copied from interface: SoftWrapPainter
        Allows to ask about horizontal offset to be applied to the given 'x' coordinate if drawing of the given type is performed at the given graphics buffer.

        Generally, this method is useful when we don't want to perform actual drawing for now but want to reserve a space necessary to do that in future. I.e. the aim is to avoid horizontal movement of already drawn content when the drawing is actually performed.

        Specified by:
        getDrawingHorizontalOffset in interface SoftWrapPainter
        Parameters:
        g - target graphics buffer to draw in
        drawingType - target drawing type
        x - target 'x' coordinate to use
        y - target 'y' coordinate to use
        lineHeight - line height used at editor
        Returns:
        horizontal offset that would be introduced if the drawing is performed

      • canUse

        public boolean canUse()
        Description copied from interface: SoftWrapPainter
        Allows to answer if it's possible to use current painter implementation at local environment (e.g. there is a possible case that particular painter that exploits unicode symbols for drawing can't be used because there is no font at local environment that knows how to draw target symbols).
        Specified by:
        canUse in interface SoftWrapPainter
        Returns:
        true if current painter can be used at local environment; false otherwise

      • reinit

        public void reinit()
        Description copied from interface: SoftWrapPainter
        Called after a change of font preferences in editor, so that a painter could reset any related internal caches.
        Specified by:
        reinit in interface SoftWrapPainter
